Help us propose and support good legislation that promotes civil liberties and block legislation that would take our basic freedoms away.

Dear ##first_name[ACLU Supporter]##,

Our team has been preparing for months for the opening of the Iowa Legislature. From today through April, state representatives, senators, and staff will be working overtime to create new laws – some good, some bad.

That's where you come in. It can be easy to default to apathy and believe that your voice doesn't make a difference. But now, more than ever, it's critical for you to stand up and speak out. Especially in a state like Iowa, just a half dozen or so constituents making their opinions known can get the attention of a state legislator and change the course of history.

We'll have boots on the ground at the statehouse – our policy director, a contract lobbyist, a community engagement associate, our communications staff, and me – to do our best to propose and support good legislation that promotes civil liberties and block legislation that would take our basic freedoms away.

What can you do?

Check out the key civil liberties issues we've identified for the upcoming session.

Find out who your legislators are and where they stand on the issues.

Find out more about how you can effectively communicate with your state legislator.

As one of our wise supporters recently said, democracy is not a spectator sport. Work with us to take action for a better Iowa!

Best,

Mark Stringer
Executive Director
ACLU of Iowa
